"how do tax defer annuity work","there be 2 basic classification of annuity immediate defer the immediate annuity provide income payment over the lifetime of the annuitant start within 1 year of the deposit the defer annuity not do start payment until a late date defer annuity may increase in value over time that increase be not subject to income tax as it occur this deferral of taxation be a major attraction of annuity a defer annuity can be either a single premium annuity or a flexible annuity as a single premium annuity it be often use augment retirement income at a late date when other stream of income may have cease it be often use anticipate increase in inflation provide a much need boost in income as a flexible defer annuity the contract allow the owner make deposit on either a schedule unscheduled basis into the policy as mention previously earnings on the contract be not tax in the year the money be accumulate a defer annuity can be classify into 3 major group the first will be the fixed annuity  the second will be the variable annuity and the third will be the indexed annuity the fixed annuity be issue an insurance company the owner make at least one deposit and everything that take place later be the responsibility of the insurance company the company guarantee the growth and guarantee the future payment there not be any market risk in this policy a variable annuity while structure similarly the insurance company that issue it allow the owner can select the fund that will accumulate provide future benefit in some case it may extend the privilege of select underlying fund into the annuitization phase which will result in uneven result but have the potential of exceptional growth an index annuity lie somewhere in between the index annuity be design the insurance company but rather than pay a guarantee rate of interest base interest payment on the performance of 1 the leading market indicator commonly these policy be link to the Dow Jones average or the Standard and Poors index the annuity have restriction on the amount of interest credit the interest rate can either be cap at a preset percentage or the policy can be write so that only a percentage of the rate be apply to the money in the annuity the trade-off come when the company guarantee a minimum rate of interest that minimum rate be often 0% what this means be the annuity can participate somewhat in the increase experience in the stock market without the risk of lose anything this be quite attractive and currently very popular an aspect of all annuity that be often overlook be they be not subject to probate that mean as a contract the value of the annuity pass to a designate beneficiary without the expensive time consuming process know as probate taxation of annuity be another subject but it be important know where the annuity be go be hold determine its taxation","1"

"will Life Insurance accrue interest","term insurance do not accrue interest and whole life policy accrue dividend universal life insurance do accrue interest there be 3 different type of universal life insurance that will accrue interest : fixed Universal Life accrue interest base on a rate the insurance company indexed Universal Life - pay interest determine an external index such as the s & p 500 if the index go up then interest be pay usually up a cap if the index be negative then there be usually a floor of 0 - 2% so no interest may be pay but this policy provide downside protection variable life - interest be pay according to the stock or bond market this cash value in a variable policy may go up or down depending on the market","1"

"be Medigap good than advantage","each type have it pro and con Medigap plan commonly know as Medicare supplement plan work with Original Medicare ( Parts A & B fill the gap that it do not cover original Medicare cover about 80% your healthcare expense a Medigap plan can cover a portion or all of the other 20% depending on which 1 you get that be a big pro you also be not restrict to network  you do not need referral see specialist  any doctor that accept Medicare will accept the Medigap plan  you can apply for a different plan at any point throughout the year if you want a different carrier or different benefit and they be guarantee renewable the only con be it typically cost more than an advantage plan advantage plan can be a lot cheap but have more restriction and limitation than a Medigap plan do the big attraction with them be the cost factor as the premium be very cheap and some plan even feature a $0 premium - they can also include drug coverage ( you have buy a stand-alone part d prescription drug plan if you want prescription coverage when you have a Medigap plan some of the drawback that you can have network restriction the plan coverage can change each year your doctor can choose to no longer accept that specific plan you lock in to that plan a year can only change it during the annual enrollment period oct 15 dec 7 of each year if you qualify a special enrollment period please note regardless of which type of coverage you must have both Part A & Part B and continue pay your part b premium even though advantage plan work in place of original Medicare - Medigap plan work with original Medicare","1"

"what do renter insurance typically cover","the following be a small part of the coverage typically provide renter insurance policy : 1 fire or lightning 2 windstorm or hail : this do not cover loss a. cause directly indirectly by frost  cold weather  ice other than hail  snow or sleet all whether wind drive or not ; b. to the interior of a dwell other structure or to the property inside cause by dust  rain sand sleet  snow or water ; this exclusion 2.b do not apply if the building cover or contain the property cover first sustain an actual damage to its roof or wall by the direct force of wind or hail then we pay for loss to the exterior or interior of the building include the property in it which be cause dust  rain  sand  sleet  snow or water which enter the building through opening in the roof or wall make the direct action of wind or hail c. to watercraft except rowboat and canoe on the insured premise including their trailer  accessory  equipment and outboard motor unless such property be inside a fully enclose building 3 explosion 4 riot or civil commotion 5 aircraft : this include self-propelled missile or spacecraft and the object fall from them 6 vehicle : this include only direct loss from actual physical contact of a vehicle with cover property but we do not pay under this peril for loss or damage to fence  driveway and walk 7 sudden accidental damage from smoke : this do not cover loss cause smoke from agricultural smudge industrial operation 8 vandalism or malicious mischief : this do not cover loss if the insured premise be vacant for more than 60 consecutive day immediately before the loss a dwelling under construction be not consider vacant this do not cover loss cause vandalism or malicious mischief committed by an insured or tenant *** remember every policy be different please read your policy completely understand the coverage provide and any exclusion there may or contact your local agent have them go over the policy with you","1"

"what be a child rider on term Life Insurance","a child rider on term life insurance add life insurance to your policy that will cover your child ( ren it be usually available to child age 15 day to approx age 17 ( the age vary by company you select a face amount of the child rider usually between $5000 and $25000 this that will pay if a tragedy occur in your family and you lose one or more your child the child rider benefit will pay that entire amount for each deceased child the rider pay for death by any reason just as your policy do with the exception of suicide in first 2 year or if your child have a serious health condition that be not disclose on the application and death occur during the first 2 year of purchase the rider if your child have type 1 diabetes  intellectual disability or other malady unfortunately they will not be able be on the rider.Therefore  it be good get the rider while your first child be young ; then the rest be automatically add while few child pass away the real value of a child rider can come when your child turn approx 25 ( again the age vary by company at that time the child rider can usually be change to a permanent life insurance policy of about 5 times the face amount of the child rider they do not ask any health question so if your child develop an illness after be put on the rider it will not matter they will then have a reasonably price life insurance policy for the rest of their life","1"

month or be face eviction or foreclosure you receive a shut-off notice from a utility company you recently experience domestic violence you recently experience the death of a close family member you experience a fire  flood or other natural or human cause disaster that cause substantial damage to your property you file for bankruptcy in the last 6 month you have medical expense you can not pay in the last 24 month you experience unexpected increase in necessary expense due to care for an ill disabled age family member you expect claim a child as a tax dependent whos deny coverage in Medicaid "what be medical loss ratio in Health Insurance","the medical loss ration be a figure that measure how efficently health insurance premium be be use actually pay for plan member coverage basically healthcare reform have dictate that heath insurer medical loss ration can not be under 80%:20%  this mean the premium pay policy holder must be use the insurance company so that at least 80% those premium go toward pay for member medical cost and no more then 20% go toward the company profit / overhead cost if a health insurer have a small medical loss ration <80% then it must issue rebate their policy holder in the form of the difference divide the total number of policy holder","1"

"how exactly do a Life Insurance trust work","assume you be address irrevocable life insurance trust ILIT  the chronology of event and ownership be very important the grantor not can have any incident of ownership the ILIT must be the owner and the date of the ILIT must precede the policy date the ILIT will name the beneficiary of the trust and premium pay the ITLIT grantor must conform to annual gift tax or unify credit rule avoid taxation of premium consult your legal adviser before move forward with any creation of ILIT","1"

"be universal life insurance whole life","whole life and Universal Life be the 2 main type of permanent insurance coverage there be subcategory with in that e.g. guarantee universal life  current assumption universal life  indexed universal life  participate whole life  non-participating whole life and other permanent life insurance in general be design provide coverage the rest of the insured life and build cash value universal life insurance feature a flexible premium structure it be in short  a blend between term life insurance and whole life insurance a universal life policy will guarantee the maximum death benefit for the low possible premium make it much less expensive than a whole life policy with the same death benefit like with whole life insurance universal life will build cash value although it will generally not accumulate as much cash value over the life of the policy as a comparable whole life policy it essentially term insurance to age 121 with the emphasis on a large death benefit instead of great cash value the premium that you pay universal life be ideal for anyone who want maximize the death benefit and be not worry about build cash value you can guarantee benefit up to age 121 ( with most company these policy can be structure dial down the death benefit to a specific age as well e.g. to age 90  95  100  105  etc. which can reduce your premium a good margin whole life insurance be a great vehicle for planning for the future the premium and death benefit remain fix and guarantee for life while the policy can build cash value at a great rate - this structure be know as a non-participating whole life policy the other type be call participate whole life policy participate WL policy can pay out dividend which can use in several way 1) decrease the premium the premium will eventually hit $0 at some point the policy will in essence self-sustaining mean the dividend equal to or greater than the premium the program if great the difference can use to increase the cash value increase the death benefit 2) purchase paid-up addition these addition increase the face amount of the policy 3) increase the cash value at a faster rate whole life have many advantage  it be also the most expensive form of life insurance whole life feature level premium and death benefit and build cash value at a fast rate than universal life policy - the trade off between be increase the cash value faster the premium will be substantially high can often be 2-3x the premium of guarantee universal life policy on many occasion please note regardless of the permanent coverage type the carrier take back the cash value upon the death of the insured and pay out the death benefit proceeds therefore guarantee universal life policy allow you maximize your death benefit and minimize your premium dollar that you pay for the coverage I hope the information be helpful - please feel free contact me for assistance with your coverage and if you have any other question thanks very much","1"

"can I be deny long term care insurance","yes you can be decline for a medical condition and/or adverse health history as it pertain to morbidity morbidity involve a reduce ability perform mental physical activity such ailment as arthritis  cognitive impairment  Alzheimer's disease  advanced osteoporosis  lung malfunction and blindness be all classify under morbidity if 1 use tobacco and have any morbidity issue  that usually result in a decline as well but smoking by itself do not often result in a decline.Underwriting for long-term care insurance be get tight Genworth for instance will soon be require some medical work for applicant which may include lab test ( urine sample and blood draw .Carriers be also move toward gender based premium with male applicant cost be low than female applicant cost due to the fact more woman go on claim than man this be also true for most insurance so it be not a new concept life insurance cost be high for man than woman because woman live long Disability Insurance have have gender based rate for quite a while only Montana have mandatory uni-sex rate for all insurance.Before submit a formal application for long-term care  an applicant shall be prescreen by complete a medical questionnaire provide either the carrier the represent agent applicant shall answer all answer truthfully completely determine medical eligibility it be good be tell not submit an application due to confidential prescreening than have a formal application decline","1"

"how much will I be tax for not have Health Insurance","start jan. 1st 2014 the tax penalty for not have health insurance be $95 per person for the year ( up to 3 person max per household and where dependent under 21 count as half a person or 1% annual income whichever be great but for the Initial Open Enrollment Period you have from oct. 1st 2013 to march 31st 2014 sign up for a plan avoid the penalty ... for example a family of 4 or more will only pay a max of $285 in 2014 ( $95 x 2 adults= $190 plus 2 child at $47.50=$95 for a total of $285 but for a single individual they will most likely pay the 1% income up to the $285 max i.e. a single 33yr old with $22000 annual income will pay 1% or $220 for the year because $220 be greater than the $95 per person and below the $285 max household after 2014 the tax penalty increase to $325 in 2015 or 2% income up to $975 max ( 3x$325 follow $695 in 2016 or 2.5% income up to $2085 max ( 3x$695 and then adjust to cost of living increase thereafter also the penalty can be prorate so if you be only uninsured for 1 month out of the year where a penalty will be applied you will only pay 1 month worth of penalty ( i.e. for 2014 if you miss 1 month you will pay $95/12=$7.92 per person or 1% your income / 12 and due to the application process and effective date for insurance 1 day of be uninsured equal 1 month so be very aware of when you apply for insurance and when it will take effect it be good work with an insurance agent or broker and an accountant calculate the exact tax implication for your individual situation assure that you be indeed responsible pay the tax if you be exempt from it","1"

"how much be renter insurance a year","renter insurance be by far 1 the most cost effective insurance policy available and can be purchase for as low as $10 a month or less the cost vary based on several key factor first  the amount of personal property coverage the insured require choose the amount of coverage that be right for you consider the personal property coverage will protect every item you bring with you or purchase since you move into the location second be the amount of personal liability coverage the insured require this portion of the policy protect the insured shall they hold liable for personal injury to someone else or to another individual property the third factor will be type of coverage with the choice between Contents Replacement or Actual Cash value in a nutshell actual Cash value policy pay less per item for any loss since they factor in depreciation and current value of an item where contents replacement only consider how much be spend on the item purchase it originally finally the amount of deductible on the policy will also play a role in determine how much the insured will pay per month the high the deductible  the low the monthly payment","1"

"what Health Insurance shall I get","figure out what health insurance you shall get depend on several factor - mainly how much risk be you willing take on and how big of a check be you willing write you have the option for bronze  silver  gold and platinum level plan as you go up in metal  the price go up but provide good benefit some area also have a catastrophic plan available in addition your age be a big factor as well the young you be the cheap your premium - the old you the high your premium also if you use tobacco product your premium can be increase up to 50% as well bronze plan generally cover about 60% your healthcare expense  Silver be 70%  gold be 80% and platinum be 90% so in short the better the benefit that you want have  the high the premium will be.This be where an independent insurance agent can really help you they can work with you look at a wide range of option from many of the top carrier in the industry so in short if you want have good protection and take on less risk you may want look at a gold or platinum plan if you want simply keep your premium down and do not mind take on more risk you may want look at a bronze or silver plan","1"

"when can you drop Health Insurance","it depend upon whether you have individual or group health insurance if you be cover under an individual health insurance policy you can terminate your coverage essentially at anytime when I say essentially if you have make your monthly premium payment and decide in mid month you want cancel your coverage that cancelation almost certainly will not go into effect until the first the next month it be highly unlikely you will be allow cancel retroactively or get a prorate refund cancel group health insurance coverage can be more complicated if your employer be use a Section 125 Plan and you be pay any portion of your premium on a pre-tax basis in this situation you be lock into your coverage until the next open enrollment period unless you experience what be call a change of life status event this will be an event like get married  divorced have or adopt a child give the most common example simply decide you do not want the coverage anymore or hit a rough patch financiallyin and ofthemselves arenot a qualify event under IRS guideline do not meet the criterion for terminate your group coverage so your employer have a section 125 pre-tax plan in place and these day most employer do be a key factor in determine whether or not you can drop your coverage at sometime other than the plan annual renewal","1"

"what be the major Advantage of term Life Insurance","the major advantage of term insurance you get more bang your buck so to speak mean the rate per $1000 of coverage that you pay much less than permanent coverage however the trade-off that you only get to pay that rate a short amount of time 10 15 20 25 30 year whereas your rate can lock in life with a permanent insurance policy once the initial period of premium guarantee expire the policy change to either annual renewable term insurance with premium increase each year ( based on age or the premium remain the same and the death benefit decrease each year ( this structure can be see on term insurance that be feature on a universal life chassis there be no cash value build up in term insurance permanent life insurance be design provide coverage the rest of the insured life and build cash value under a guarantee universal life ( gul program the policy can be structured keep premium level and provide coverage up a specify age e.g. age 90 age 100 or even up age 121 under the dial down process whole life feature level premium death benefit build cash value at a faster rate participate WL policy may pay dividend that can use to increase the death benefit decrease the premium over time non-participating WL policy do not feature this ability the trade off between this guarantee universal life that to increase the cash value faster the premium will generally substantially high for both gul and WL the carrier take back the cash value upon the death of the insured and pay out the death benefit proceeds therefore gul policy allow you maximize your death benefit and minimize your premium dollar that you pay for the coverage I highly recommend consult with an experienced life insurance broker review your specific situation and help determine what life insurance will be most suitable meet your need and budget  review quote and help you through the application and underwriting process I hope the information be helpful - please feel free contact me for help and if you have any other question thanks very much","1"

"do homeowner insurance cover electrical work","if you own the house that be describe in a homeowner policy there be coverage for the house locate on the property which include addition and built-in part and fixture there be also coverage for related private structure that be also on the describe property which be not attached to the residence when there be an occurrence that be not expect or intend the owner to the property there be coverage this coverage mean physical injury to tangible property and this include the loss of use electrical wiring and fixture be component of a residence and may be present in private structure locate on the premise such as a pool shed or detached garage when electrical work be require because of damage to the structure the electrical work become a cover expense policy differ as to which peril be cover the most comprehensive form be call all risk in this form any damage to the residence be cover except the list be not long ; however flood and earthquake be at the top of the list electrical work pose another problem in that after damage have be sustained the repair work may fall under restriction  code  ordinance and law that be not in effect at the time of the original construction the insurance company do not pay for the increased cost which result from the enforcement of these law and code some company do not apply this to glass most company offer a provision cover these cost at an additional premium the policy make it clear the company do not pay for damage that be the result of the neglect or the insured it also do not pay for damage that be the result of power disruption this mean if your loss be the result of the utility company fail supply power the result damage be not cover this be assume the actual damage be not on the cover premise the insurance company do not pay for wear and tear there be many way describe this damage that be sustained because the house be not maintain some of the issue that arise be deterioration  mechanical breakdown  rust  wet or dry rot  corrosion  mold  contamination or smog the insurance company do not pay for electrical work that be the result of an act commit by or at the direction of the insured in summary if the electrical work require the result of a fire lighten windstorm hail explosion riot aircraft vehicle sudden accidental damage by smoke vandalism theft fall object weight of ice snow sleet collapse of a build sudden tearing apart accidental discharge overflow of liquid steam from plumb heat air-conditioning system freeze the policy will pay repair of electrical component of the residence other structure on the premise if the electrical system need repair as the result of other factor such as wear and tear there not be any coverage the homeowner policy be design cover you when the unexpected occur","1"

"can a Health Insurance company drop you without notice","No. A health insurance company must provide a policyholder with proper advance notice of any policy cancellation you shall receive a write notification from your insurance carrier of their intent cancel coverage  an explanation for the cancellation and the date the policy will be terminate cancel an individual or group health insurance policy be not something an insurance carrier can do arbitrarily and can get them in big trouble with the state insurance department and possibly the federal government now if you engage in fraud in apply for a health insurance policy the insurance carrier be within their right cancel your policy and may even cancel it retroactively to the date of issuance but they will still have provide you with notice  an explanation and a chance appeal the decision an example that we will probably see more of in the era of ObamaCare where health insurance rate can significantly different from 1 side of a state line to another the situation where a person enroll coverage state that they a resident of a state like Tennessee where more health insurance option exist rate lower when they really a resident of Arkansas where choice limit rate high it be also possible an insurance carrier will cancel an insurance policy product line  withdraw from a marketplace or go out of business all of which be situation where an insurance carrier cancellation will be initiate the insurance company however they be still require provide policyholder with timely notice even in these event","1"

"how much do car insurance go down at 25","most people not do enjoy pay their auto insurance premium each and every month so they often look forward to schedule rate decrease such as at the age of 25 why do car insurance rate decrease at this age well because the majority of crash claim be file by young age 16 through 24 and old driver as a driver mature they become less likely become involved in a crash according to statistics so offer an incentive for driver stay with a particular insurance company  discount be often offer at the age of 25 while it be generally true auto insurance rate will decrease at the age of 25 it not be always the case driver can expect their car insurance rate decline at the age of 25 assume the following remain constant their drive history  incident history and the make and model of their car if all of these factor remain the same male driver can expect a premium discount as high as 20% while female driver can expect a 12-15% discount on their rate keep in mind the above discount range be average ; there be not currently a standard amount of deduction that can be expect ; rate decrease will depend not only on the driver history but the insurance company  the type of coverage select and the overall state of the economy","1"

"what be an aggregate deductible in Health Insurance","you have ask the question that confuse more consumer and insurance broker than just about any other terminology in our industry usually this question come up in the context of a high deductible health plan associate with a Health Savings Account ( HSA there be 2 type of deductible offer with these plan ; aggregate and embed an aggregate deductible plan require more than one deductible be meet before the plan coinsurance and other coverage provision come into effect usually 2 deductible have be meet but you will want check the exact policy language for the state you be purchase coverage within for example you purchase an HSA plan with a $3000 aggregate deductible for you and your spouse and this plan have 100% coinsurance after the aggregate deductible have be meet what this mean in practical term be both of you will have meet an aggregate total of $6000 in out-of-pocket expense before you and your spouse be cover at 100% so let us say spouse A have $3000 in medical expense for an outpatient surgery while spouse b incur no expense at all that year and then spouse A have an additional $1000 in expense for office visit and prescription even though spouse A have already have $3000 in cover expense because the deductible exposure of spouse A and spouse b be aggregate together the additional $1000 expense incur spouse A later in the year be charge against the aggregate deductible amount and remain an out-of-pocket expense under an embed deductible arrangement with the same $3000 deductible follow 100% coverage each spouse have a separate $3000 deductible exposure that once meet place that particular spouse into their 100% coverage zone so in the example use in the previous paragraph spouse A will have meet their deductible with the initial $3000 expense and their $1000 in subsequent expense will have be cover at 100% the insurance company generally the premium difference between plan with an aggregate and an embed deductible be not that significant especially as deductible get high for this reason I rarely recommend an aggregate deductible plan design my HSA client if you will like more information or a quote for a Health Savings Account base plan please feel free contact me","1"

"when do you pay tax on annuity","it depend what type of annuity it be and if the annuity in a Qualified Retirement Account not if it be in a qualified account like an IRA / 401k/SEP then any distribution be 100% taxable if it be a nonqualified account then only withdrawal of the gain be tax as income but since annuity use LIFO the gain will be the first part of the annuity that be distribute the growth of a nonqualified Fixed Annuity be tax defer if it be an immediate annuity / lifetime annuity then again it depend on the tax status for a qualified account 100% the distribution / income will be taxable for nonqualified a portion of the payment will be tax-free and consider a return of basis / premium","1"

service have be steadily increase for decade health insurance cost be merely a reflection of these underlying factor when 1 drill down to a specific company or a specific individual history with their health insurance premium then you will find substantial variation in individual result a knowledgeable experienced health insurance broker / consultant can often manage their client benefit cost in way that beat the market just like there always be some financial expert who outperform their peer in the stock market the vast majority of my small business client for instance have premium cost and benefit level in 2014 that be not radical departure from their cost of a few to several year ago or at the bad they know they have the good possible base cost level currently available to them in their marketplace this require constant oversight of change marketplace condition switch insurance carrier take advantage of whichever carrier have the good value proposition at that particular time and some fine tuning of benefit plan designs and funding approach over a period of year accomplish these result but it can be do because I have do it the implementation of the new requirement of ObamaCare have upset the long established rule for the health insurance marketplace and be have a profound impact on health insurance plan designs and cost ObamaCare address many access issue to health insurance coverage ( guarantee issue of policy  no pre-existing condition  etc. but really do nothing reduce either healthcare cost or consumption in fact many can argue ObamaCare be help increase both cost and consumption which will translate into high health insurance cost certainly ObamaCare be the most profound change in our nation health insurance system in most people lifetime and it will make the year ahead much more challenging for both individual and business when it come to manage their health insurance & health care cost the guidance of an experienced health insurance expert who be stay on top of the rapid change be prompt ObamaCare be now more important than ever to both the individual and business health insurance consumer if I can be of assistance in guide you "what be the penalty for not have Health Insurance under Obama care","under the affordable care act everyone will have have health insurance or pay a penalty also know as an individual share responsibility payment if you choose pay the penalty instead of secure coverage you will still be responsible for 100% your medical care the penalty be calculated in 1 2 way ( you pay whichever be the high amount in 2014 the penalty will be calculated as 1) 1% of your yearly household income feature a maximum penalty as the national average yearly premium for a bronze plan $95 per person for the year ( if under age 18  then $47.50 feature a maximum penalty per family of $285 under this method the penalty calculation will change each year in 2015 method 1 increase to 2% your yearly household income and method 2 increase to $325 per person in 2016 it will increase again to 2.5% for method 1 and $695 per person for method 2 the penalty method will be adjust for inflation in late year I hope the information be helpful - please feel free contact me for help with your coverage or if you have any other question thanks very much","1"

"what be the good permanent Life Insurance policy","determine which permanent life insurance be the good come down to your specific need there be several different type of permanent life insurance available include Universal Life  indexed Universal Life and Whole Life of these 3 main type Universal Life have the low premium Universal Life can last your entire lifetime and will typically be consider the most basic type of permanent life insurance indexed Universal Life and Whole Life be 2 other type of permanent life insurance and each 1 can have cash value build up inside the policy the cash build up be calculate differently in each of these type for an indexed Universal Life policy you pay a premium that more than cover the cost of insurance and the excess cash build up inside the policy that buildup of cash be credit interest base on an index or combination of index and how they perform over time your cash value be never in the market but can grow if the market be up year overyear the IUL can be design build up a large cash value over the year and that cash value grow tax defer if you need cash along the way you can get a loan against your policy and use it for your own need many people use an IUL build cash value for college expense supplement their retirement income whole life insurance policy generally offer fixed premium in a participate whole life policy the cash value inside the policy increase as the insurance company provide dividend base on the overall return on its investment earnings beyond those need cover policy expense go to the policy cash reserve from which you can use cover future premium or borrow against during life journey supplement retirement income","1"
"what be Roth IRA 401K","Roth IRA and a define contribution plan form your employer under section 401 (k) be both retirement plan but be quite different the Roth IRA be your individual plan fund with after tax dollar while the employer sponsor 401 (k) be your employer planyou have access to your contribution and eventually to your employer contribution after a period of time your contribution be make with before tax dollar the 401 (k) benefit in retirement after age 59.5 be fully tax as ordinary income while the income from the Roth IRA be not tax at all","1"
"what be a Roth retirement plan","encourage people prepare for retirement individual retirement ( IRA account be allow congress these plan allow a participant reduce their current income tax by the amount of the contribution to an IRA the entire amount of the proceeds upon retirement be then taxable as ordinary income a Roth plan approach the same issue in the opposite way it do not allow a current deduction for contribution to the plan  however at retirement the entire amount in the plan which include all the interest earn be pay the participant without any income tax there be limitation in contribution and you shall consult with an accountant","1"

"how do Disability Insurance work for maternity leave","this be a very common question and the answer be it depend on the carrier and its definition of total disability normal pregnancy be not consider a disability some carrier in fact it be clearly exclude from coverage in the contract for other as long as it fall into their definition of what constitute a total disability they will replace income after the elimination period be satisfied the definition of disability be key a typical definitionmight be something like the inability perform the usual customary duty of the occupation ( job in which the insured be work at the beginning of a disable event a less favorable definition will add the word and be unable work in any other occupation since many woman be able to performthe primary duty of their occupation during the first 2 trimester of a normal pregnancy some carrier do not automatically consider a leave for pregnancy a trigger point replace income and if they do 90 day be a typical elimination period a kind of time deductible before 1 qualify for benefit - most woman will probably not satisfy the elimination period before the baby be born anyway if there be complication result from pregnancy then that be a whole different situation and if they start occur early enough in the pregnancy and do qualify under the definition of disability the elimination period will theoretically start soon and benefit may be pay out before birth if you be begin a new job and think you may become pregnant or intend become pregnant during the time you be employ with that company be sure ask Human Resources if the company provide disability insurance as a group benefit and if the coverage include normal pregnancy","1"

"do auto insurance affect credit score","the short answer be no this be a question commonly ask client  especially those that be look for new insurance on a car or house they be want finance every inquiry they people be tell  can lower their credit and can affect the interest rate on the final loan while this be a general statement that be often true  it be very broad and non-specific and overlook certain key detail that you need know keep in mind there be 2 different type of credit inquire hard inquiry and soft inquiry maybe you have hear of these by different name but here be what I mean by hard soft credit pull a hard inquiry 1 where you look to obtain a line of credit such as through an auto finance company a store credit card at a retail store like BestBuy sear a gas card at your shell gas station a mortgage new purchase refinance sometimes when open a utility in your name though not always try to rent a property every time you apply for credit  the underwriter people who decide extend you credit how much and at what interest rate can see the inquiry and some of the fico score model be about 10% compose by the number of inquiry that you have basically the more credit you apply for the risky you become because you either be get decline and the new company want know why or you be get a lot of credit and the next company have concern you can pay all of this new credit at once therefore it be important you keep all the inquire to a minimum when possible ( less than 2 ideal 0 be the most prefer a general rule be you have authorize someone look at your credit for a hard inquiry conversely a soft inquiry be what company use when they be look at credit but not offer a line of credit you directly this be what most utility company use make sure you do not have specific item on your credit report they be look for when consider open an account in your name ; they usually be look for late pay and other item not necessarily your credit score nobody see these inquiry except for the individual when pull up their credit report which can be do for free once a year so you may get a credit report and see 2 inquiry ( 1 for the credit card you apply for and the other for a car you try refinance but then another 5-10 other inquire you not be even familiar with these can include the credit card company send you preapproval letter apply for a new credit card or utility company when you move to your new apartment not do panic as these do not affect your score with that being said which 1 these inquire be insurance insurance be a soft inquiry that do not affect your credit score if you talk to an independent agent when buy a house you can see multiple soft inquiry on your credit report from company like ASI The Hartford  Safeco  Erie  Kemper  foremost mercury and many other company this be because each of these company want know your credit-worthiness or financial responsibility because it have a direct relationship with you pay insurance on time and with the number of claim you file ( good credit means less claim as a general trend so not do be afraid get a quote for insurance your loan officer or bank manager or whomever be right in saying not do apply for new line of credit or anything that pull as a hard inquiry since that affect your score however get an insurance quote for home auto  life or health insurance not do affect your credit at all not do forget pull your credit report once a year from the 3 major credit bureau you will probably see your new insurance company on there however insurance company not will pull credit if it be not important make sure review your credit once a year and verify everything be accurate the only official website annualcreditreport.com so go there for your free report","1"

"how much do a long term care insurance policy cost","we have enter into a new phase of the development for cover the risk of have pay for long-term care cost and therefore a new phase of designing coverage the consumer do not have pay a fortune for at least some coverage but expectation over how much risk 1 can afford transfer to an insurance company may require some reality therapy.A base plan for a couple can cost around $3000 - $5000 per year depending on age the design be simple : a fixed pool of money with as much access to it ( maximum daily monthly benefit that 1 can afford there be no accommodation for inflation and no rider except perhaps the monthly home care rider which if not part of the contract shall be add it do not cost much as a rider the pool shall be around $300000 if possible.A value plan for a couple can cost between $5000 and $7000 per year the design include the low cost inflation rider  monthly home care rider if not include in the base plan and maybe survivor waiver of premium the pool of money pay care cost and daily monthly access to it shall be as much as can reasonably afforded.A premium plan which we use illustrate routinely 5 year ago for a couple can run from $9000 - $14000 / yr depending on which combination of bell and whistle you want and can afford this design will include 1 the automatic annual 5% compound simple benefit increase rider available rider can include share care spousal waiver of premium  0 day elimination for home care  nonforfeiture rider and/or return of premium other rider depending on the carrier may be available note : this design be most likely to experience in force premium increase over time due to the uncap benefit increase rider.For a single person drop the above range of number down $1000 for the base plan  $2000 for the value plan and $3000-$4000 for the premium plan.These be all very round number the point be column and article in the press recently have only look at the old way of thinking about long-term care it pointless to dredge up old statement by insurance company which at the time reflect their ignorance of a) how many people will actually use their policy b) how many will keep them in force if premium rose the lapse ratio 1-2% about the low in the insurance industry adjust their benefit to stay in the game c) how few people will buy long-term care insurance the percentage of American own their own coverage about 7-8% holding.The probability of need to pay or all of the cost of extend professional care at home or in a facility be still relatively high as we live long not necessarily better no LTC insurance policy can promise pay all care cost but be anyone go be turn away a payment from an insurance company that cover half those costs?Some coverage be good than none","1"

"what be the original purpose of Health Insurance","health insurance can trace its root back to the 1920's in the US the first health insurance be introduce inTexas offset the cost of hospital stay Blue Cross be found specifically for this purpose several year late Blue Shield be add help offset doctor charge as technological advance in the medical field particularly after WWII cost rise rapidly the idea of manage care be advance with the purpose that if people will regularly schedule appointment to doctor  they can determine high risk much faster and avoid large hospital cost in the 1970's the HMO ( health Maintenance Org gain favor and under president Nixon a bill be pass that will require employer with greater than 25 employee offer coverage through an HMO by the early 1990's the demand for the flexibility of a traditional plan in addition to the cost saving of the HMO plan  bring us the PPO and the Po doctor Office visit copay and prescription drug copay become the norm the number of law govern healthcare and what policy be require pay increase nearly 1000% technological advance be happen at a break neck pace with each law require more health issue be cover and the advance in technology  ultimatelycaused premium increase dramatically in 1993 in TN a $1000 deductible for a 35 year old male be $41 per month how thing have change the government answer be fix the financing mechanism conclude they can control cost by force the financing aka insurance company follow strict regulation sound great except insurance company be require minimize the amount they pay doctor  hospital  etc ( provider ; while provider be have serve twice as many patient for the same money and go into $100k plus in debt just get through med school can you say train wreck?Which bring us to where we be today that maybe a bit more than you ask in question the original purpose of health insurance which in simple term be set up to exchange premium for the possibility of an expensive hospital stay in the future","1"

"can my car insurance drop me","yes they can in certain situation I will say first that I can only answer for Michigan but most state do behave similarly your eligibility for auto insurance with a standard carrier be measure on a point system be eligible for a standard carrier in Michigan you not can have more than 6 eligibility point the point system be pretty simple with more point for more serious infraction for instance a speeding ticket for 5mph over the speed limit and other similar violation be worth 2 point while an at fault accident be worth 3 these point do have an expiration normally two to three year for accident and minor violation major violation such as a DUI or wreckless driving expire in 5 year and 1 these deem you ineligible your insurance company can cancel your policy if you reach 7 point or more that have not expire 2 at fault accident in the last 3 year will also get you here as your second at fault be charge 4 eligibility point 2 thing consider first  you can still get insurance if you have be cancel but it will cost you a lot more second do not think just because the judge say he will waive the point from a ticket these will not count for insurance purpose because they will if it show up on a driving record or a claim record the company have no choice but apply them if you have a good agent he can find coverage you even if you have be cancel a company be smart  find an agent you can trust and listen to him / her you will come out good in the long run","1"

"how do Medigap plan work","Medigap policy serve as a supplement to original Medicare original medicare be an 80/20 plan where Medicare pay 80% the approve charge the beneficiary be typically responsible for the 20% coinsurance as well as copay and deductible that come with Medicare part A & B. the Medigap policy be design pick up the 20% Medicare do not cover in exchange for a monthly premium payable to the carrier select the most comprehensive Medigap policy be Plan F which cover all of the Part A & B deductible  coinsurance and copay so when the beneficiary go receive care their be 0 out-of-pocket cost some plan may also provide benefit like foreign travel as well as a gym membership as part of your regular plan please note : when purchase a Medigap Policy you need add a stand-alone Prescription Drug plan satisfy your requirement as a Medicare Beneficiary have part d - Prescription Drug coverage meet","1"

"when do Health Insurance cover a tummy tuck","as a general rule a tummy tuck be view as cosmetic surgery and be not cover health insurance police however obesity become an increasing problem in our nation.This have result in a growing number of people who have reach health or life threaten level of morbid obesity for which they have have either prescription and/or surgical treatment that result in extreme weight loss in some case the weight gain have stretch the person skin to such an extent after their extreme weight loss following treatment their skin do not return to normal level and the person be leave with fold of skin which can in some case become source of medical problem themselves e.g. severe rash and infection in these extreme circumstance the insurance company may agree it be an issue of medical necessity that this issue be surgically address and the will approve coverage for the removal or lifting of this excess skin tissue this have be the only circumstance where I have see an insurance carrier approve what may be construe as a tummy tuck","1"

"what do gap insurance cover on a car","gap coverage be generally purchase on a brand newvehicleeither the lender or the insurance carrier when youpurchaseyour auto insurance this coverage be design fill the gap between what the car be value at and the actual loan amount shall there be a total loss auto insurance be pay on an ACV ( actual cash value basis in the example of a new car you may have purchase avehicleworth $40000 and take out a loan say for example 1 year later you total thevehicleand the value of thevehiclea the time of loss be $35000 this amount be what the insurance company will pay however due to interest rate and other varying factor your loan amount can be $38000 at the time of loss leave you with a $3000 out of pocket expense or in other words a gap however if you purchase the gap coverage the gap will be meet either the lender or insurance company whoever you take the coverage out with I always recommend gap coverage on anewlypurchased vehicle this coverage generally stay on your policy for 2-3 year and then fall offdependingon the insurance carrier talk to your local agent about gap coverage on your newly purchase vehicle","1"

"what be the difference with term and whole life insurance","that be a great question it be actually probably the most common question I get term policy be perfect for people who have very tight small budget and need insurance or that have a debt that they need have cover for a short period of time.For example  let us say you just graduate college and have a lot of school debt repay and a start salary job a term policy that insure you until the loan debt be pay or until you get a high pay job be a great option or if you just have a baby and want increase your coverage ensure the baby college expense and need will be pay for if something be happen to you again a good option if your need be for something that be more permanent that you know you will not outlive and that will have a reserve of cash that you can draw from if need then you will want a whole life policy they be more expensive then a term policy but they be also go pay out providing you keep the policy in force while the vast majority of term policy will end without ever pay term policy also will not have any cash value  shall you need it or wish surrender the policy once you have a whole life policy  the price be generally set and do not change nor can you be drop from them find affordable coverage once your term policy end can sometimes be difficult or impossible if you have age considerably or your health have have some serious setback I hope that help thanks for ask","1"

"why do Disability Insurance never pay 100 your income","the purpose of insurance be not get ahead compensate for what be lost therefore insurance company put limit on benefit so that people do not use insurance come out good than they will have if they have not have the misfortune that cause them collect on their policy in the case of a permanent disability it be hard imagine any benefit high enough compensate for that loss but there be those who will recover fully  yet never return to work if they can continue receive their full salary without have labor for it the latter be the type of activity insurance company try discourage by put limit on the benefit it be not just so their company can make money  although I be not saying that do not enter in it be also so premium can stay low and the company stay solvent for the benefit of all their policy holder","1"

"what do cash value mean in regard to Life Insurance","that be a great question simply put there be 2 value to your whole life policy - the face value or death benefit which be what the policy will pay shall you pass minus fee or loan and the cash value the cash value be the amount of money that accumulate within the policy as it grow this be the amount that you can borrow from or the amount minus loan or fee that the company will pay out you shall you surrender the policy there be no cash value in a term life policy I hope that help - thank for ask","1"

"how do bank own Life Insurance work","bank own Life Insurance or bolus be a process where a bank purchase life insurance on a key employee ( executive or director usually several of them in return for allow the purchase of life insurance on their life the bank will traditionally offer some sort of additional compensatory benefit to the employee know as nonqualified defer compensation this can come in several different form from an extra life insurance protection to additional retirement income benefit provide the employee stay with the company for a certain period of time the bank then can include cash value from the life insurance policy on its balance sheet there be 1 important note regarding this due to bank regulation bank be only allow recognize 50% cash value in an insurance company general account on their balance sheet as a result several company have specialize bolus product that use separate account typically find with variable life insurance product so the bank can recognize 100% the cash surrender value on their balance sheet","1"

"how much term Life Insurance shall you have","there be no exact figure on how much coverage someone shall have and we all have our own need and cost tolerance a good way figure out how much coverage you shall have be by total up the debt and other expense you want have pay off in the event you pass away suddenly e.g. mortgage  car  kid college expense  credit card  other loan  etc. then determine the amount of income need for your spouse and kid if you die - this be generally around 70% current income amount and multiply that by the number of year you want make sure they be take care of at that level ( e.g. 5 year  7 year  10 year  etc. if you have investment income or other source of savings the total amount of coverage need may vary this be a good starting point and shall help you create an approximate figure of how much coverage you shall have in place the number of year of coverage depend on the need ( some may be 15 year  some 20  some 30 etc. you shall consult with an independent life insurance broker who can work with you on a personal level determine how much coverage you shall have meet your goal and create a suitable structure for your budget in many case you will likely need a large amount of coverage for the next few year and less coverage down the line for example you can structure your coverage have $1000000 of coverage for the next 20 year and have it drop down to $500000 for year 21-30 if you need coverage for more than 30 year ( most do you shall consider supplement the term insurance coverage with a permanent insurance policy ( universal life or whole life I hope the information be helpful - please feel free contact me for assistance with your coverage and if you have any other question thanks very much","1"

"what be Disability Insurance coverage characteristic","the important factor that will play a large role in both the cost of a Di policy and how meaningful the benefit will be to a individual the benefit amount  the elimination period  the duration of the benefit period and the way in which the policy define a disability the benefit amount  the recurring monthly income your disability policy pay you while you be injured represent the most important aspect of the coverage law in most state limit disability insurance benefit to two-thirds your current gross income while most people select the maximum available benefit you can choose low amount if your personal cash reserve be sufficient supplement disability income payment after you meet the criterion and be eligible begin receive income from your disability insurance policy the length of time you must wait before payment begin be call the elimination period most major insurance carrier offer the same standard elimination period range from 1 month to 1 year long period result in low policy premium once you begin receive payment from your disability policy they will continue until you be no longer disabled or your benefit have be exhausted disability insurance policy with maximum benefit period of 2 year less be classify as short-term disability product if you own a short-term policy payment will continue every month but will cease after 2 consecutive year policy with maximum benefit period beyond 2 year be classify as long-term disability product the most common benefit period choice for long-term policy be 3 year 5 year 10 year until age 65 every insurance company have its own formal definition of a disability and benefit payment will not start unless your status fall within these guideline some company define disability as an inability perform any gainful income produce work at all collect benefit under policy purchase from these carrier often present a significant challenge thankfully a large percentage of carrier consider you disabled if you be unable perform the substantial duty of your own current employment position  a policy feature commonly refer to as own occupation if your injury prevent you from adequately fulfill the requirement of your current job you be eligible begin collect benefit after the expiry of the elimination period","1"

"who shall own Life Insurance policy","who shall own a life policy depend on fact and circumstance surround the purpose of the insurance often the owner be the insured and name a spouse the beneficiary life insurance purchaser be require have an insurable interest in the life of the insured insurable interest generally must exist at policy inception the underlying principle be a purchaser must have a reasonable expectation of profit or benefit from the continue life of the insured you have no limit on insure your own life so you can name anyone as the beneficiary of your own policy when you take out a policy on the life of another there be limit on who can own the policy : 1 family member relate blood or marriage have an insurable interest in each other e.g. parent / child and child by adoption  sibling  spouse  grandparent / grandchild and in some state engage couple there be generally no insurable interest in niece / nephew  cousin  aunt / uncle  other relative by marriage or stepparent / stepchild 2 creditor have insurable interest in a debtor to the extent of the debt 3 business relationship which give rise to a financial dependency : an employee can insure an employer or vise versa partner can insure each other key employee can be insure their employer so for example 2 cousin who will otherwise not have an insurable interest jointly own a business and therefore have an insurable interest in the other the life insure always need consent with their signature and will need consent by signature to the release and use of their medical information in the underwriting process for underwrite policy","1"

"do Health Insurance actually make people healthy","health insurance itself do not make anyone healthy or sick remove or reduce the financial barrier to access healthcare that health insurance make possible help create an environment where preventive care be encourage and health problem may be detect at early more manageable stage past statistics show a correlation between have health insurance and good health however those statistics come from the era when underwriting of health insurance for risk be allow and individual can be decline for coverage for preexist condition starting in 2014 such practice be no longer allow in the fully insure health insurance marketplace and so a totally different risk pool be be create and we be essentially work on the assumption expand access care will correlate with improved health care outcome as health care reform ease access some segment of our population that may have on the outside look in in the past it also raise premium cost out-of-pocket expense to level that either force some previously insured person out of insurance coverage significantly raise the out-of-pocket expense they must incur before their coverage kick in which may deter some people from seek need treatment for this reason the jury will be out for some time as to whether our current health insurance reform effort will yield improved health for the general population a person can have the good health insurance possible but if the individual do not take responsibility for manage their health ( smoke cessation  weight management  exercise  etc. their overall health status be unlikely improve","1"

"where do Health Insurance come from","in the 1920's change occur that tend increase the role that medicine play in people life shift the focus of treatment from home to hospital these change cause the price of medical care rise because of advance in medical technology grow acceptance of medicine as a science development of hospital as treatment center encouragement sick people visit physician and hospital licensing and standard of care in 1929 2 doctor Ross and loo form Ross Loos Clinic provide medical care 2000 employee of the water department of Los Angeles for $1 per month per employee Ross Loos grow to 29 location in LA provide medical care city employee at a fixed cost per month whether they visit the doctor or not the precursor to Blue Cross be found in 1929 a group of Dallas teacher who contract with Baylor University hospital provide 21 day of hospitalization for a fixed $6.00 payment the Baylor plan develop as a way ensure people pay their bill 1930-1940 : the birth of Blue Cross and Blue Shield prepay hospital service plan grow over the course of the Great Depression prepay hospital care be mutually advantageous to both subscriber and hospital during the early 1930s when consumer and hospital suffer from falling income prepayment plan seek the Blue Cross designation have provide subscriber with free choice of physician and hospital  a requirement eliminate single hospital plan from consideration despite the success of Blue Cross and prepay hospitalization policy physician be much slower in provide prepay care Blue Cross and Blue Shield develop separately with little coordination between them physician worry a third-party system of payment will lower their income interfere with the physician patient relationship and restrict the ability of physician price discriminate in the 1930s physician be face with 2 situation that spur them develop their own prepay plan Blue Cross plan be become popular and some physician fear hospital will move into the realm of provide insurance for physician service thus limit physician autonomy advocate of compulsory health insurance look to the emerge social security legislation as a logical means of provide national health care physician begin organize a framework for prepay plan that cover physician service in 1939 the California physician service ( cps begin operate as the first prepayment plan design cover physician service open to employee earn less than $3000 annually cps provide physician service to employee group for the fee of $1.70 per month for employee the AMA encourage state and local medical society form their own prepayment plan these physician sponsor plan ultimately affiliate and become know as Blue Shield in 1946 Blue Shield plan offer medical surgical benefit for hospitalize member doctor charge patient who be subscriber Blue Shield the difference between their actual charge and the amount for which they be reimburse Blue Shield that be where health insurance begin","1"

self complete shall death interrupt the accumulation phase permanent life insurance come in several style which will match the investment option normally available to those who be interested in a Roth adventuresome there be life policy in which the cash value be invest in a separate fund this be normally administer the insurance company but may have a good yield that the fund hold in the company general fund there be another form where the detached cash value earn interest base upon 1 several popular market index these indexed universal life policy allow you experience some of the gain of the market while often limit the downside of the market those who want experience the fluctuation and opportunity of the market there be variable life policy where the cash value be fully invest at the discretion of the policyholder these policy have great risk and potential reward","1"

investment return and claim experience of the insurance company in any give year the policy owner can direct the company use the dividend in any 1 four to six way depending on the carrier all but 1 those option will not produce an incometax event take the dividend as cash however will most whole life policyowners either choose have the dividend purchase pay up addition of insurance ( increase the death benefit as well as the cash value of the policy reduce premium with excess purchase pay up addition non participate whole life or interest sensitive whole life do not pay a dividend but it most likely do provide some level of a guarantee death benefit and guarantee cash value some whole life policy now provide the opportunity overpay the guarantee level premium for a period of time to turbo charge the growth of the cash value which grow tax defer this require the addition of a paid-up addition rider ( PUAR and there be limitation on how much overpayment 1 can make this capability "what be single payer National Health Insurance","Single Payer National Health be when there be a nationwide health coverage insurance that be manage and pay for by a single institution Medicare be such a policy it have a uniform coverage for all participant across the nation and be pay for the federal government there be good bad element to this type of coverage good : A guarantee baseline of health coverage for all citizen in the country regardless of financial means and employment status there will be no such thing as loose your job and then loose your coverage since nearly all people live in the country will be on the insurance nearly all doctor and hospital will have take it because there will be few patient willing pay out of pocket for treatment no bankruptcy because you get sick there be around 2 million bankruptcy in 2013 because of healthcare bill this will not happen because the risk and cost of healthcare be share among the entire tax pay population bad single payer system provide a lack of choice there will be no competition for the good coverage or the good network of provider so it can potentially reduce opportunity for innovation and provider push for that competitive edge if someone want anything more than baseline coverage you will still have buy up much like senior do with Medicare advantage plan so the national coverage will not solve all the problem funding be limit federal budget and tax income this mean provider will be reimburse based on what the government can afford this can lead to shortage particularly in expensive treatment because the profit motive be not as well fuel complexity be an issue we all know haw bloat and complex government agency  just think if they try and care for 350 million patient and all of their health issue","1"

you to a specific plan that allow you leave all the investment decision to professional or handle them yourself the key be the deposit in the annuity be a transfer of capital from current consumption to future consumption the result of the annuity while important be not nearly as important as the decision move asset from the present to the future an annuity do this quite well an annuity can also be purchase outside a qualified retirement plan while lose some of the tax advantage of the qualified plan the annuity still accumulate money free of current income tax and allow the owner a great deal of flexibility in draw the annuity down an annuity address the issue of excess withdrawal risk by make regular payment without the ability raid the bank since excess withdrawal have ruin many retirement program this be a very important issue the monthly check be like a paycheck and the retiree learn live within their means an annuity address the frailty risk in it be already establish before the retiree become frail it be very simple negotiate and the retiree will not require any professional assistance use the annuity in the same vein it address the issue of financial elder abuse because in most case no one can access the fund  not even the annuitant other than a variable annuity most annuity be not subject to market risk once the annuity start make monthly payment they will continue for life regardless of the performance of the market annuity be also not involved with interest rate risk annuity can be establish in such a way efficiently handle the unexpected loss of a spouse the annuity can be set up pay the same or a reduce benefit for the lifetime of the survive spouse an annuity can be an efficient way reduce stress in retirement the result be predictable ; it do not require anything from the annuitant and will be there as long as the annuitant survive an annuity be a contract that be execute outside the estate and can pass directly to the beneficiary without the time consuming probate procedure this can provide cash for pay estate tax or final expense an annuity be a very important part of the retirement income plan it have its own tax regulation it do provide you a clean slate if you total a car with a loan on it let look at an example : Erica buy a 2009 Volkswagon Jetta from a use car shop for $14000 the use car value can be 12500 depending coverage state it will repair her car for specific reason in the policy or pay her the actual cash value of the car if it cost less than the repair it will take make the car driveable often a state variation will come here say a car can not be repair if the expense be 70% or more the value of the car the insurance company need pay the policyholder the actual cash value of the car instead if you in your limit ( such as 100/300/100 limit it state it will repair the damage cause your action that you be hold responsible for or pay the actual cash value of that item if less than the cost of repair this be important  so remember it so what do this mean for Erica know this information let say Erica have have her Volkswagon Jetta for 3 year and diligently make payment on her car without miss a payment date the loan be now $9000 after interest the value of the car have depreciate down to $7600 because of the age  mileage and usage of the car technically Erica be pay $1400 more on the car than what it be worth take interest out of the equation make it easy let say at this 3 year mark  Erica get into an accident and the car be beyond repair it do not matter if she cause the accident if someone else at fault because both property damage what the other party use to fix erica car if they cause the accident collision coverage the coverage use to fix erica car if she cause the accident use actual cash value to determine how much repair will make how much money they will pay Erica both coverage will give Erica $7600 for her car however since Erica have a lien on the car because she be finance it that money actually go to the finance company and erica wont see a penny of it the finance company will apply that $7600 to her loan mean there be a $1400 balance left she be responsible for the bank not be a charity so they will still tell Erica she have pay it because it be still in her contract and the bank lose $1400 on a car that no longer exist Erica still have pay $1400 on a car she do not even have and still have buy a new car Thats a bad place be in life will not you say even worse Erica may still have make payment even if the accident be not her fault she get all of the blame of the finance company but cause none of the problem if Erica have gap insurance it will kick in at this point and relive Erica of the extra $1400 she will be responsible for if Erica be ahead of her loan and the cash value of the car be more than the loan  she will get any money pay above the loan amount thus satisfy her finance company as well and the gap insurance will not take effect either way Erica not be pay money any more on her car that be non-functional here be some common stipulation find in gap insurance check with your loan company see if they apply to you : gap insurance be there pay for the loan on the car and THATS it if you increase the loan pay for any extra you be typically not go get that part of the loan cover and will still have pay this include thing like the extend warranty  credit life insurance in case you die before the loan be pay off and thing like that it may even say the gap insurance be not pay for either and you will have pay for that its definitely worth look into gap insurance also say that it wont take effect if you be behind on your payment on a certain amount  pay more because the car be worth less from overuse or modification and wont cover intentional damage to the car basically its not there handle your loan if you be financially strap and can not handle the payment anymore and want get rid of the car "how do an auto insurance deductible work","that be a great question deductible in insurance speak  the amount of money that you need pay before the insurance company pay their promise share the idea be if you have pay a part first it be an incentive for you be more careful and avoid claim that will cost you money the amount of your premium payment hinge in part upon the deductible that you choose the more you be willing pay the less you monthly payment be as a rule the lower your deductible  the more the insurance company have pay so the high your payment the trick be find a balance between what you can afford pony up your deductible vs. the monthly cost of the policy I hope that help thanks for ask","1"

"how do guarantee Life Insurance work","if by guarantee life insurance you be refer to guarantee issue life insurance that be coverage that can not be decline for health reason the policy usually have rather narrow age guideline  low maximum face amount and be grade during the first 1-3 year for death due to natural cause e.g. if the insured person die of a heart attack during the first year of the policy the beneficiary will receive a reduce death benefit ( often return of premium plus a little extra if death occur after the grade period end the policy pay the full face amount it usually pay 100% the face amount from day 1 for accidental death some guarantee issue life insurance policy premium be guarantee not go up for life some can go up every year and other be in between ( e.g. can go up every 5 year keep in mind you will want be able afford this policy in the year ahead and get lifetime guarantee level premium if possible guarantee issue life insurance can be a good choice for people who can not qualify for any other coverage even if death be anticipate within the first 2 year the return be good than any savings account and people be often able survive serious disease beyond what be expect if by guarantee life insurance you mean life insurance where the premium and face amount be guarantee it simply mean the premium can not go up and the face amount can not go down for a certain period of time in term insurance the guarantee level period be usually for the term of the policy in Universal Life the guarantee period can be for life or it can be for a set number of year","1"
