"do home insurance increase every year","home insurance be a generic term for either Homeowners Insurance (Owner Occupied or Dwelling Fire Insurance Tenant Occupied Landlords Policy the primary purpose of a home insurance policy be pay for the reconstruction of the home in the event of a fire ; in addition to this primary purpose there be many additional item which be cover against a number of peril list on the policy form in order to maintain sufficient coverage rebuild the home in the event of a total loss most policy include an inflation guard endorsement ; the main purpose of this endorsement be increase the coverage slightly each year keep up with the annual adjustment of build cost inclusive of material and labor it important a home not to underinsured policy have a build in coinsurance clause which can cause financial hardship to a homeowner in the event there a large loss the home find not to sufficiently insured the coinsurance clause will only provide coverage on a percentage basis equal to the same percentage of insurance purchase against the actual replacement reconstruction cost of the dwell some company will allow the inflation guard be remove by the insured ( by sign request ; however the prior paragraph may explain why this be not the good option for a homeowner although the endorsement have no monetary charge ( premium remove it may heavily impact the policy if a loss be occur in future year the inflation guard endorsement may increase coverage amount by 2 5% based on the current year cost of construction an equally small increase in the annual insurance premium however it commonly to the homeowner surprise that insurance premium adjust each year by all carrier base on the prior year loss experience to the carrier the aggregate rate zone all home in the area we receive call each and every year request remove the inflation guard blame the endorsement for an increase in annual premium ; many time carrier may have a 5% increase in a give area and a 2.5% increase in coverage limit insurance carrier be heavily regulate the Department of Insurance in each State ; they be also carefully audit by rate agency most commonly by a.m. Best Company who issue insurance company rating it important insurance company to offer excellent customer service excellent expedient claim service pay the full replacement value of all claim present that cover by the subject policy over above this the carrier must maintain financial reserve in order to hold their secure position to handle future loss offer the security that customer expect from an insurance company if for example a homeowner insurance premium be $500 per year 1 can imagine there be not much profit be make after the aforementioned responsibility and performance guarantee on extraordinary year where insurance company post great gain the auditor and department of insurance will require a rate reduction since the profit percentage of the carrier be limit and closely regulate the government although it be not common following many year in the property insurance market we have see reduction in annual premium following profitable year the operation of an insurance carrier be not as simple as issue a policy and collect a small premium ; there be so much more to the contract and operation for those interested it be worth contact a license representative of your present insurance carrier and inquire gain a good understanding","1"

Medicare be design help the elderly pay for acute sickness and accident from whichone can heal relatively quickly it do not cover chronic illness or prolonged rehabilitation from an accident however Medicare will provide payment of cost for some short-term recovery for the elderly that be enroll in Medicare part A & B. there be prequalification and limitation to what it will pay for  how much it will pay  the type of care it will pay for for how long maximum of 100 day payment for long-term care be usually pay out of pocket or by Medicaid ( medical in CA receive payment for care from the latter 1 must be impoverish as define the state that they live in and they usually must be in a facility ( Medicaid / medical only pay a few 100 dollar a month of home care the only other solution to the problem of pay for long-term care either at home or in a facility be long-term care insurance ( LTCi this sector of the health insurance industry be in a bit of turmoil right now and if you have decide you want explore LTCi  make sure you work with someone that be a specialist in this area there be an infinite number of designs in coverage which can vary the cost ( premium by thousand dollar a year also be sure you be work with agent that only work with the good LTCi company in the industry  those that have strong financials  high rating and be committed to the field the most important thing be have a plan your plan may or may not include LTCi but if it do buy no later than your mid-fifties as the price really start climb after that not do depend on Medicare for the payment of long-term care cost","1"

"when be a whole life insurance policy pay up","a whole life insurance reference as be pay up mean the policy be self-sustaining because of the size of the cash value relative to the face amount and the interest and dividend earn can keep the policy go forever without the need any more premium payment keep it go the policy use the cash value pay the premium for the policy if you borrow from the cash value for a pay up policy you can affect its ability keep the policy go without pay more premium in short you can make a pay up policy no longer pay up - you may have start pay premium again some policy be specifically design stop premium payment after a certain number of year ( e.g. a 10 pay  20 pay  pay age 65 you be pay more in premium per year but the overall sum total that you pay over a give time e.g. compare to pay a low premium for 35 year can offer savings in the long run I hope the information be helpful - please feel free contact me if you have any question thanks very much","1"

"what be the definition of Medigap","Medigap plan commonly refer to as Medicare supplement plan be design help senior who want high quality healthcare and be on Medicare  cover the gap between what hospital and doctor charge for their service and what Medicare will pay.Health insurance be constantly change which can make find the right plan for you very strenuous supplement your original Medicare coverage ( Medicare part A & b with a Medicare supplement plan will help you create a very predictable expense structure for your healthcare and allow you see any doctor you want that accept Medicare any doctor that accept Medicare will also accept your Medicare supplement plan there be 10 different Medicare supplement plan and they be all standardise mean a plan f from company A and a plan f from company b feature the exact same benefit the 10 different plan available be plan A  b  c  d  f  g  k  l  m and n a high deductible plan f be also available that feature a $2140 deductible in 2014 - the trade-off be a substantially reduce premium each plan offer certain benefit some more comprehensive than other each plan must cover a core set of benefit also know as the basic benefit the basic benefit be 1) Medicare part A coinsurance plus coverage for 365 additional day after Medicare benefitsare use up Medicare part b coinsurance or copayment 3) first 3 pint of blood 4) part a hospice care coinsurance or copayment there be a total of 9 benefit that can be secure the other 5 benefit available under a Medigap plan 1) skilled nurse facility care coinsurance 2) Medicare part a deductible 3) Medicare part b deductible 4) Medicare part b excess charge 5) foreign travel emergency up to plan limit each plan feature a different structure each plan cover a different combination of these 9 benefit some of the plan feature coinsurance copayment for certain benefit if cost be not a major factor for you plan f will be the recommend choice because it cover all 9 benefit at 100% - it be the most popular plan by far if you be look keep your cost down but still have very comprehensive coverage  you may want look at plan c  g and n as well when you look to buy a Medigap plan you shall consult with an independent Medigap insurance agent to review the plan in detail to see which 1 will best serve your need help you identify all of the carrier offering Medigap plan in your zip code which 1 will able to offer the coverage to you at the low cost the plan standardise so the big difference between them price the benefit exactly the same regardless of the carrier you have the Medigap plan through I hope the information be helpful - "how do a Life Insurance policy loan work","permanent life insurance policy build cash value and be an asset you may borrow some of the cash value by take a policy loan unlike most conventional loan however repayment be actually not require if the loan be not repay prior to the death of the insured the amount will simply be subtract from the policy reduce the death benefit take a policy loan be not the same as withdraw cash value the insurance company will charge you interest on the money you receive from the loan in most policy dividend be not pay or the interest rate credit be reduce on the amount of the cash value impair a loan in other words there be usually a material net cost of borrow which will add drag to the policy over the year usually policyowners call up the insurance company  request a policy loan and do not repay it or the loan interest over time in this case the interest will be add to the loan and loan will continue accrue interest at an even great rate if the loan exceed the cash value the policy will eventually lapse Whats worse any gain ( gross cash value minus premium pay become taxable income obviously this shall be avoid so it be especially important work with your life insurance professional manage your policy carefully note interest rate and loan provision vary widely for policy loan : recent product innovation through loan have become quite complex since some policy be good than other for take policy loan your life insurance professional can help identify the good way proceed whether analyze a policy with an exist loan or plan the purchase of a new policy with the idea of take policy loan in the future e.g. supplement a retirement plan","1"

"what be FSA in Health Insurance","an FSA be the abbreviation for a Flexible Spending account plan which an IRS approve means of allow employee set aside payroll deduct dollar on a pre-tax basis use for several different type of employee personal expense most people encounter an FSA in the context of set aside money cover medical dental vision expense not cover their group health insurance plan but you be not require be enroll in a health insurance plan in order to take advantage of your employer FSA plan also there be type of FSAs ( dependent care be an example that I will not go into at this time for 2014 the maximum amount an individual can set aside in an FSA have be reduce to $2500 but this change have be somewhat offset a change to the use it or lose it rule which in past year mean any unused dollar in an FSA account at the end of the plan year be forfeit the account holder now up to $500 in unused FSA fund can be roll over from 1 plan year to the next such rolled over fund do not count against the $2500 maximum deduction the employee can make in the subsequent FSA plan year so some accumulation in now allowable if your employer have amend their FSA plan document allow for this an additional take away though be over the counter medication be no longer eligible for reimbursement from an FSA setting aside fund in an FSA account reduce the employee gross taxable income on a dollar for dollar basis so depend upon the tax bracket an employee be in the potential tax savings can be in the 25% to 40% range when federal  Social Security and possibly state tax be take into account an FSA can be a very cost effective tool in help employee get more value by pay for eligible out-of-pocket expense","1"

"be Disability Insurance a deductible business expense","in a word  yes but it be more complicated than that there be 3 different type of Di insurance and each have its on tax treatment strategy individual disability insurance ( IDI - this be what most people be refer to when they use the term DI it replace a percentage of income it come in 2 flavor long-term short-term if the premium be deduct as a health insurance medical expense on a schedule c the income replacement benefit shall 1 become disable - may be taxable as regular income if it be pay out-of-pocket the income replace when disabled be not income taxable the choice shall be refer to a qualified tax advisor as insurance agent be not authorize advise on tax issue however I do not know a CPA that will recommend deduct premium as a health insurance business expense if 1 become disabled they be go want their benefit check be free from income tax business Overhead Expense ( BOE or simply OE if a business owner or partner become disabled this type of insurance pay for a percentage of fixed business expense in my experience tax advisor will direct the premium for this coverage be deduct as a business expense because while that make the benefit income taxable the benefit will immediately pay for business expense which be deductible so it be a bit of a wash so to speak.3 buy-out disability insurance - this type of Di be most commonly purchase sever a business relationship of an owner or partner that become totally disabled and thereby be a drain on the business without be able actively produce or grow the company the amount pay out be a lump sum which can be base on percentage of ownership or stock and theoretically be place into a fund that will produce a continuing income to the buy out owner or partner typically the business own this policy and pay premium on it the tax treatment of the premium and payout depend on how the Articles of Incorporation be write or what kind of buy sell agreement in place both the company attorney tax advisor need to in on how the contract title who pay premium at the time of application.It imperative the consumer of Di insurance to consult with qualify legal tax advisor if there any question at all about how the payment of premium will treat the benefit use the agent may offer an opinion but it shall not be accept as legal tax advice","1"

"how do Life Insurance build cash value","this can be complicated but I will try keep it simple if you have a Whole Life Policy the premium be base on how long you be expect live average out over that length of time the policy be expect be in force term insurance seem cheap because it be not design cover you for your whole life that be why the cheap form of life insurance be 1 year term every time a term policy renew the premium go up until it eventually become unaffordable because a whole life policy average these premium out you be pay more in the early year than term but in the late year you premium will be less than term since the policy do not need renew the excess money collect in the early year be invest and after expense the balance be put into the cash value they use a lot of complicated formula determine this but this be a simplified explanation","1"

out more in claim than they be receive in premium they file with the state insurance commissioner to review and adjust rate in your state several thing cause the claim experience of a company increase it can be the frequency of claim increase this can be the result of reduce safety enforcement  poor road condition or a variety of other cause it can be the severity of claim have increase this will be the result of an increasing number of accident turn into lawsuit it also can be cause jury make increasingly high award to those injured in accident it also can be the result of increased medical cost in your area another factor can be the cost of auto repair material and part tend become more expensive over time and this can affect the claim experience of a company it be important note most company in the state will feel similar pressure at the same time as those factor affect all the company there be moral factor that also come affect the premium of auto insurance when driver report fewer annual mile than they actually drive that increase their exposure without increase the premium for their policy if people allow other driver operate their vehicle without adequate supervision of "how do renter insurance Payout work","when you report a claim on your renter policy the company will assign an adjuster the claim the adjuster will collect all the necessary data prepare a settlement of the claim if the claim be a liability claim the company will pay for defense cost and judgment up the limit of the policy if it be a loss of property they will normally determine the actual cash value of the item lose and offer that amount minus the deductible as settlement if you replace the item lose and have replacement cost coverage they will send subsequent amount reflect the cost of replace the item lose","1"

"what kind of annuity be out there","there be many different kind of annuity offer many different insurance company each annuity have its own feature I typically group annuity into 4 main category immediate annuity : this be an annuity that begin a payment stream upon purchase shortly thereafter within a year the payment be guarantee for a period of time or for a lifetime or lifetime in the case of a joint payout variable annuity : this annuity have tax defer growth that be base on the performance of the subaccount within the contract the owner of the annuity can choose which account allocate their fund the performance of the annuity can be either positive or negative so an owner be assume some level of investment risk fixed annuity : this annuity have tax defer growth that be set for a fixed period of time the interest rate of the annuity be usually set at the purchase date but can be adjust at a late date in some contract the performance be usually a know outcome and highly dependent on the length of the annuity contract indexed annuity : this annuity have tax defer growth that be base on the performance of an particular index ( e the owner can choose which index e allocate their fund such as the S&P but their fund be not actually invest in that index the index be only use determine the performance the performance of indexed annuity be usually only 0 or high with a limit on the upside know as a cap these be general definition and be by no means suggest which be good or more appropriate for any situation my recommendation if you be interested in learn more about annuity be speak with a professional license describe the pro and con of each annuity type base on your particular situation","1"

"what be universal Health Insurance","universal health insurance can also be refer to as single payor health insurance and be a term use denote a health insurance system that cover all citizen of a nation generally the concept of a universal Health Insurance system be use in reference to the government run or manage system such as be find in Canada and many European country while there be variation on the theme from country to country the objective as the name imply it provide health insurance coverage every citizen of the country regardless of their income or health status usually universal Health Insurance system be fund tax pay the nation citizen and business the concept of universal Health Insurance sound appeal to many and be become part of the ongoing debate in the United States about how finance our citizen health care need in theory everyone will have comprehensive health insurance coverage with the cost spread out amongst every citizen and with low overhead cost as a single  government run agency administer the health insurance system in practical term the real world result of such system have fallen short of perfection and have their own set of problem and source of dissatisfaction just as we experience with our current mixture of private and public based health insurance system here in the United States","1"

"what be UCR in Health Insurance","UCR be short for Usual Customary and Reasonable mean your health insurance company will only pay what they consider be a usual customary reasonable charge for any cover expense you incur if your doctor be in your insurance company network then they have agree accept this UCR as payment in full however it be not uncommon a doctor refuse accept health insurance participate in any HMO or PPO network in such a case if you doctor charge more than the amount your insurance company consider be UCR you be responsible for the rest of the bill worse yet any amount you pay above UCR will not count towards your deductible your out pof pocket spending limit if you ever find yourself in such a situation I suggest work with a medical bill negotiation service most of these service cost nothing if they do not save you any money and only charge a small percentage of any amount they be able help reduce your bill ( typically 30% the savings","1"

"how do dual Health Insurance work","by dual health insurance I will assume you be refer to a situation where a husband and wife each hold job with different company and both job offer health insurance dual coverage almost always be a waste of money health insurance have a cob ( coordination of benefit clause that be design prevent overpayment when a claim be submit each carrier decide who be primary and that carrier pay first the secondary carrier then review the claim and pay their portion if there be any liability more often than not the secondary carrier pay little or nothing but between the 2 they will not pay more than 100% the claim amount in other words you will not profit on the claim and cob often be a delay and hassle","1"

"what be the coverage characteristic of home insurance","a home be the large single purchase that most people make in their lifetime there be 2 characteristic that make home ownership difficult the first be the ownership of a home create a situation of responsibility where you become responsible for personal injury and property damage that come out of home ownership for example someone enter you home  slip on a rug and fall injury can be minor or severe it be quite possible you can be sue recover the loss sustain the person who fall this be a liability loss the second be you have an enormous amount of your money and the mortgage company money invest in the home it be usually a multiple of your annual income and will represent a great financial loss be the home destroy your mortgage company be particularly concerned about lose their collateral and will require hazard insurance protect their interest to the great extent possible the list of thing that can happen damage a residence be lengthy but most of the cause or peril be contain in the ho 3 homeowner policy there be notable exception which shall be restate you be probably not cover for damage cause earthquake or flood these coverage be available but in slightly different form and often with different policy because an individual can not sustain the personal loss of a law suit or the destruction of their property they turn to an insurance company pool their risk with hundred thousand other residence this recognize the probability of damage and spread that risk over a large number of residence the insurance company charge enough be able pay those loss when they occur your state insurance commissioner be very concerned about the adequacy of the insurance company admit in your state while there be various type of home insurance policy I will confine my comment to the most common the ho 3 homeowner policy coverage A in a homeowner policy cover your residence the coverage include additional item but do not cover land or water it not do cover tree except as cover in incidental coverage coverage b cover related structure on the property it have the same restriction as coverage A and do not cover any business structure except for a residence on the property that you lease other it cover you garage coverage c cover the personal property that you either own or be responsible for this be a very important coverage and contain internal limit on select class of property such as money  security  jewelry  gun and watercraft misunderstanding often arise about this coverage and it shall be discuss thoroughly with your insurance agent modification of this coverage be relatively inexpensive and an unpaid claim be an expensive way discover you be not adequately cover coverage d pay the necessary reasonable increase in living cost you incur when your household meet with an insured loss the company will try get you back into your residence as quickly as possible but will make sure you be able maintain your normal standard of living during the repair coverage d also cover the loss of rent you may experience in the event of a cover loss if you have an apartment on the premise and it be damage a cover loss this section will apply there be other limit and extension in this section that require your attention if you be lease property there be number of ancillary coverage include credit card  tree  fire department charge  debris removal  emergency removal of cover property and grave marker there be several page of definition and exclusion which shall be read most confusion arise from a homeowner policy come from this part of the policy many people think a homeowner policy pay for routine maintenance or deterioration coverage l cover personal liability and provide the company will pay up the limit for expense that you be liable for because of bodily injury or property damage that happen on your premise coverage m cover medical payment to other and provide necessary medial expense if they be incur on your property and result in bodily injury there be several page of definition and limitation on liability coverage the policy then define your responsibility you must notify the company of a loss  you must cooperate many other responsibility at the back of the policy be a number of endorsement which change the policy these apply to specific type of property such as trading card  animal  a roof and other together the ho 3 homeowner policy be a package of protection that be sufficiently broad meet the requirement of both lender and homeowner special additional coverage be offer and shall be consider many of these additional coverage can be include in the basic policy","1"

"what be all risk homeowner insurance","> Normal 0 All homeowner policy will cover your home and personal property shall it damage but the type of damage you be cover for be define in 2 general type of insure agreement 1 type name peril will tell you what specific type of damage you be cover for the policy will actually name them ; fire  lightning  wind  hail  theft  vehicle damage  vandalism  etc. damage be cover you have prove to the insurance company that the damage you sustain be cause 1 these name peril the second type of insure agreement ( often refer to as all risk cover you for any direct damage unless the policy specifically exclude or limit it under this form of insurance any damage be cover unless the insurance company can prove a specific exclusion or limitation apply the burden of proof shift from you prove you be cover under a Named Peril policy to the insurance company prove you be not cover under an all risk type policy a small difference which mean a lot shall you have a claim the term all risk be not use too much anymore ; this type of policy be often refer to as Special Form or Open Peril policy whatever you want call them this be the type of insure agreement you shall look for most of us be not prepared prove anything to an insurance company its also much easy understand what you be not cover for simply by read the exclusion and limitation","1"

"how do universal life insurance work","Universal Life be also know as flexible premium adjustable life - this be the official name of this type of product it describe in a simple way how the product work premium be flexible because that can be adjust upward downward you can also skip premium you also have a choice of level increasing death benefit which describe the adjustable nature of the product universal life build cash value that can grow base on a state fixed interest rate which may vary over time but which will never be less than a guarantee minimum interest rate policy cost for administrative expense and cost of insurance be deduct from the cash value monthly universal life be best suit satisfy the long term need of policyowners who want premium flexibility and cash value accumulation that reflect current fixed interest rate return with a guarantee minimum interest rate","1"

"will get marry affect my Health Insurance","get married may or may not have an effect on your insurance policy depend upon what action you take technically add your new spouse to your policy will not change your benefit but it may have an impact on your monthly cost if you be cover under an individual major medical policy then you will see your monthly premium increase by the amount associate with your spouse age for the policy you have in force ( this assume you be cover under an Affordable Care Act compliant policy take out on or after january 1 2014 when community rating go into effect if you be add a spouse to an employer based policy then the financial impact will depend upon what your employer contribution be towards employee with dependent some employer contribute towards the health insurance premium cost of their employee and their cover dependent increasingly though employer be contribute only towards the cost of the employee coverage and the employee be totally financially responsible for the difference in cost for add a dependent to their coverage make thing even more interesting the Affordable Care Act ( ACA do not define spouse as dependent so while the practice have not become wide spread yet some employer be not allow spousal coverage under their group plan ( dependent child must be cover according to the ACA what be more common be if your spouse be employ and their employer offer health insurance and yet you still want add your spouse to your coverage the employer can assess a penalty charge above and beyond the additional premium cost for add a spouse in this situation obviously the objective here be discourage the addition of spouse whose cost and risk can be bear another employer so add a new spouse to your health insurance coverage may not be the simple transaction that it may have be in the past you need explore your option and determine what the financial implication be for add a spouse to your coverage in some situation you may find it make more sense financially purchase individual health insurance coverage your spouse than add them onto your group health insurance plan I will recommend you find a health insurance broker assist you with this decision making process","1"

"which be the good long term care insurance","the bottom line response to this question be the long-term care insurance that be in force when you be no longer able take care of 2 6 activity of daily living or be diagnose with an organic cognitive impairment like Alzheimer's disease however the question be an important 1 and deserve elaboration.The consumer ultimately have decide what the good long-term care insurance be for them that require a sometimes annoying learning curve find out how the policy work what the benefit  feature and rider be and whether 1 can afford purchase any kind of long-term care insurance at all.Long term care insurance be complicated because the issue it address be complicated the risk that 1 have about a 1 in 6 chance of need the help of someone else to bathe dress get to a restroom in time move from 1 place to another able to eat drink food sufficient 1 well-being take Rx medication in the proper dosage at the proper time among other basic daily activity over an extend period of time these ADLs or activity of daily living be formally define in a long-term care insurance policy.Clearly  there be a lot of subjective judgment regarding these ADLs and people be often skeptical about who will have the ultimate decision eligibility go on claim therefore obtain a specimen policy from your agent and read it over carefully because that be what you be considering buying - not glossy marketing material  not agent summary and simplification and certainly not the illustration that may be initially provide discussion purpose the insurance contract be a legal document and constitute the promise of the carrier to the policyowner if you do not understand how it work and you do not get satisfactory intelligible explanation from an insurance professional either the agent or a carrier representative at the insurance company home office do not buy it here be some general guideline of the good long-term care policy as represent contract language : 1 the definition section be easy understand and write in language that do not use technical jargon ; 2 the section on claim clearly indicate how 1 can receive benefits3 there be specifically state service that the carrier provide at the time of claim help the insured find qualified skilled nurse home care and quality rate facility shall full 24/7 care need this section of the document must include the word care coordinator and plan of care 0.4 customer service contact information be prominently display in bold type in a font large enough be easily read the elderly and be find in several location in the policy.5 contract language allow for the possibility of medical technical advance in care and medicine for coverage even though it do not now exist or be not definable at this time.6 exclusion be concise and easily understood.The good long-term care insurance be the kind that you understand it take a while figure it out but this type of insurance can be the difference in your die alone with no or poor care while still alive or die with dignity with quality care from people that know what they be do and have the certification and skill treat you take the time and make the effort be an informed applicant","1"

company that help manage your money it will be his job match your dream to your ability provide for those dream if your planner constantly boast about his advice and return on investment look for the exit high return on investment often go hand in hand with disastrous result the fundamental thing remember about retirement planning be return on investment be not the key issue the key issue be shift consumption when you move capital to your future you accomplish your mission fundamentally save for retirement be consume less now so you can consume more lately the return on investment be frost on the cake many who lean on return on investment find themselves unable retire in 2008 that be still burned in many people memory without step into your planner shoe I will like point out you be probably in a low income tax bracket now than you will be in the future this make it important consider a Roth IRA as your funding vehicle while not give you a current tax break it do provide a "how much do Aarp Life Insurance cost","that be a great question and I be really glad you ask AARP use a system call age banding set the rate they charge your premium be determine at first your age when you purchase the policy then when you age into the next age band your rate increase until you move into the next 1 for example let us say you purchase a $10000 policy with them at the age of 64 your price be $24.85 ( their list price for a 64 yr old male your premium will be $298.20 for the year on your birthday the next year your rate increase to $31.99 a month or $383.88 a year you will pay that until your 70th birthday when the rate increase to $44.65 ( $535.80 a year they do not list the price for the final age bracket of 75-79 but you shall expect it also jump up a good amount their policy end upon your 80th birthday they also offer a whole life policy for the same amount at $56.00 a month their policy be offer New York Life and be guarantee issue which mean if you pass for any reason within the first 2 year of the policy you will receive your premium pay and some interest get access to these policy you must be an AARP member which entail the monthly payment of membership due effectively raise your cost of insurance by that same amount unless you be take advantage of other program please contact me for more information okay thanks for ask","1"

"can Health Insurance payment be deduct","health insurance pay by an employer for coverage on an employee or the employee s dependent be deductible as a normal business expense under IRC section 162.health insurance benefit be not wage and therefore be not subject to wage tax for this purpose the term employee include an owner / employee of a c corporation but do not include owner employee of other type of business self-employed individual may deduct 100% the cost of health insurance as an above the line expense on the front page of their form 1040 the deduction be available to all qualify taxpayer regardless of whether they choose itemize their other expense direct deduction from gross income be allow only to the extent of the amount of net self-employment income excess amount if any may be deduct of Schedule A as list in the Individuals section below the term self-employed person for this purpose include nonsalaried owner of s corporation  LLCs  partner and sole proprietor underIRC section 162i WEBSITELINK except for salaried owner / employee  health insurance pay a business on behalf of a self-employed person be not a deductible business expense for example if an s corporation that pay for health insurance for its nonsalaried owner / employee  this expense be not list as a business expense on the form 1120 rather the deduction flow directly through the Form 1120S to the individual owner s form 1040 health insurance for salaried owner / employee be treat the same as regular employee except that an adjustment for self-employment tax be make health insurance benefit provide an employer be not taxable income underIRC section104and105 this include amount pay the employer reimburse the employee for the cost of health insurance of course the employee may not double dip by deduct the cost of these tax-free benefit on an individual tax return the cost of health insurance pay individual be tax deductible only to the extend the cost of coverage they pay in combination with some other specify expense be more than 7.5% adjust gross income for most people this limitation effectively mean they do not get a tax deduction for the cost of health insurance pay the cost of health insurance pay an employer be a deductible personal expense if the amount be include as wage in Box 1 of Form W2 but this be a relatively rare situation","1"

it mean you can file a claim for OTC repair hail damage to your auto here be a few thing understand about OTC with regard hail damage : you have pay your deductible for the repair most often this mean the insurance company will pay you all the money get the car fixed except for your deductible which you then pay the repair company that fix you car so if $3000 worth of repair be need fix your car from hail damage and you have a $500 deductible  then the insurance company will give you $2500 ( $3000-$500 deductible so you can pay your $3000 repair bill the claim settlement may happen in another way but the logic be still the same your OTC will pay the actual cash value of the car if the repair be over a certain threshold which be determine individually for each car make the car usable again the company can literally scrap the car and pay you for it instead of repair the hail damage keep this in mind for when determine if you want file a claim as some car be not worth much but can be in excellent condition for drive you not do want lose your car because you file a claim for cosmetic damage or keep the car and get a salvage title talk to your agent make sure you have OTC make sure the deductible be an amount you can afford pay in a reasonable amount of time its no good have a $500  $1000 or $2000 deductible for OTC if you can not get the money or put yourself in a poor financial position for 30+ day because of it sometimes pay the extra $5-10 per month for a low deductible make sense in household strap for cash","1"

make with after tax dollar the money receive in retirement be pay in tax free dollar if you be currently in a very high tax bracket the Roth IRA may not be the good choice  however if you be in a fairly low tax bracket you will find receive the money tax free in retirement make good sense most retirement program be subject to mandatory distribution that start at age 70.5 these force you take money out of a plan and pay current income tax a Roth IRA be not subject to a mandatory distribution and that inconvenience and expense be not require in the final analysis tax-free money be great by carefully plan expenditure you can use the tax-free money keep you in a low tax bracket in retirement and potentially save a great deal of money the money in your other pension plan be actually jointly hold you and the government with the Roth IRA it be all yours","1"

"do Medicare cover home care assistance","under certain condition Medicare part A will cover intermittent part-time home health care provide a skilled nurse again Medicare requirement for receive home care be quite strict Medicare will pay for home health care treat an illness or injury only if a person meetsallof the following requirement a doctor must determine medical care be need at home and must make a plan for such care the person need intermittent skilled nursing care  physical therapy  speech therapy or occupational therapy the person be homebound which mean generally unable leave home when a person leave it must be infrequent for a short time only such as go to a doctor appointment the home health care agency must be Medicare approve keep in mind unlike Medicare nurse home benefit a person do not need be admit to a hospital first in order to qualify for Medicare home health care in addition service will be provide on an intermittent part-time basis only a visit nurse  therapist or home health aide Medicare home health care benefit do not pay for 24 hour full-time care Medicare generally limit its home health care benefit because the program be only design serve individual who need intermittent care for a relatively short period of time rather than care on a daily basis once a person be receive Medicare home health care his or her plan of care will be review at least every 60 day if the person health change and care be no longer need the home health agency will notify the individual doctor who must then contact Medicare from that point home care will no longer be cover Medicare the Medicare home health care benefit will not pay for homemaker service such as housekeeping  shopping and cleaning it also do not pay for custodial carethat be help with meet daily personal need such as bathing  toileting  transfer or eat because most people who need long-term care need custodial care financial practitioner shall point out this shortcoming to client many people who do qualify for Medicare home health care benefit still need pay for additional custodial care in order to live comfortably independently at home","1"

simple review of material or the type of construction ( i.e. log home be not 1 the carrier want occupancy sound pretty simple but there be house that be not occupy seasonally occupy or even occupy a business and not something the carrier want protection stand for the type of protection afford the structure / contents from loss that can be as simple as what Public Protection Class  pc a home have ( pc represent a grading system for fire department in the US or it can be an assessment of protection from a different peril i.e. burglary and then lastly there be exposure here you may be think about the fact the home be fine but it be surround brush in CA or be a mile form an ocean or be adjacent to a chemical factory lastly keep in mind a homeowner policy also have a section for liability "when do car insurance rate go up","I agree with Cathy but also offer 1 other major reason rate go up insurer be price a product before they know their cost it something like build a spec house for sale at $300000 with out know the purchaser be go require all hard wood floor  a finished basement and a 3 car garage have you know you will have price your product at $ 400000 this be some of the dilemma of insurer thy can look at historical outcome yet may not see a trend develop before it happen the reason most auto insurance be sell in 6 month term in the US be it often take a minimum of 1 year the carrier realize rate level on all customer in a certain state and rate filing let me give an example if company a see it need rate increase on its TX auto insurance business put that rate into effect after state approval on july 12014 it will take a full six month to raise the rate level to the new level the last customer whose policy incept on 12/31/2014.Then it take the company another 6 month to earn the premium each of those customer it have set aside some money in case you decide move your business as well as keep reserve for accident that have occur or be know be likely occur in the future.So in a full year at 7/1/2015 the company have realize the effect of its rate file in the state if it now need more fund it will take the same 12 month fully earn that premium so in effect you can see that the process of get an adequate rate an insurer loss and expect loss be at least a year on 6 month police and double that to 2 year achieve the rate level on annual policy that said recognize that your rate can go up annually in a 12 month policy because of a company filing go up as much as every 6 month an insurer who use 6 moth policies.So all that said you do not control the pricing that an aggregate need of the insurer you can better protect yourself by buy a 12 month policy lock in a rate level if you do not change the exposure ( new car or new operator and such you will have lock in rate for 1 whole year so my advice be seek out an insurer that write annual policy if available","1"

"what be an accumulation period with Disability Insurance","the accumulation period in a disability insurance policy be the time frame during which your elimination period must be satisfied e.g. you have an elimination period of 1 month and an accumulation period of 3 month you break your leg  out of work a week ; go back work for a month ; your leg be not heal correctly ; you have have surgery reset it ; you be out of work for 3 week not sure when you get go back at this point your disability policy will start pay because you satisfy the 1 month elimination period during the 3 month accumulation period","1"
"what be the difference between Life Insurance and Health Insurance","life insurance pay the face amount of the policy the beneficiary name in the policy the policy do not pay the benefit until the insured person die health insurance be use the insured person while they be still alive pay for their medical care both prevent illness treat it","1"

"what be single premium immediate annuity","a single premium immediate annuity ( SPIA be an annuity that is to say an annuity be define as an income stream that continue until the annuitant die when a person pay a lump sum of money ( single premium an insurance company in exchange for that income stream ( annuity so the term single premium immediate annuity be a bit redundant think of it as take retirement money from a privately fund pension except that in this case you be fund it with a one-time lump sum of money.The important thing remember be once you pay the single premium that money be essentially gone you have just purchase an income that you can not outlive.There be all sort of way design the annuity ( stream of income you can get a monthly check  quarterly check annual check - just about any payment schedule you can think of you can also have the annuity pay out completely shall you die before the original single premium you give the insurance company get pay out shall you choose that option you will need name a beneficiary receive the remainder of the payout.Annuities in general  be complex insurance contract and space be not provided here go into all the detail but be absolutely certain an annuity be right for you before you fork over the money because once it be committed to the contract  you either can not get a refund or there be stiff surrender penalty associate with back out of the deal work only with an experienced insurance professional that have a solid working knowledge of what annuity be how they work and whether or not it be in your good interest own 1 more advanced knowledge about annuity can be obtain consumer friendly website online","1"

"what be annuity with overlap","overlap refer to a type of joit life annuity with a guarantee period joint life annuity be as the name suggest annuity base on 2 life they can be structured to - provide a level increasing annuity payment for the lifetime of 2 annuitant provide and income that reduce on the first death and continue until death of the second have a guarantee period with the proceeds be pay beneficiary if both annuitant die during the guarantee period with an annuity with overlap the initial payment continue until the end of the guarantee period and the survive annuitant also receive the reduce amount for example $10000 a year annuity income  5 year guarantee with payment reduce by 50% after first death death of 1 annuitant occur in year 2 with an annuity with overlap the $10000 will continue for 3 year ( remain guarantee period and the 50% reduction of $5000 per year will also be pay if you have far question or feel I can be of assistance please do not hesitate contact me","1"

"what be a Medigap insurance policy","Medigap plan also know as Medicare supplement plan be design help senior who want high quality healthcare and be on Medicare  cover the gap between what hospital and doctor charge for their service and what Medicare will pay.Health insurance be constantly change which can make find the right plan for you very strenuous supplement your original Medicare coverage ( Medicare part A & b with a Medicare supplement plan will help you create a very predictable expense structure for your healthcare and allow you see any doctor you want that accept Medicare any doctor that accept Medicare will also accept your Medicare supplement plan there be 10 different Medicare supplement plan and they be all standardise mean a plan f from company A and a plan f from company b feature the exact the same benefit the 10 different plan available be plan A  b  c  d  f  g  k  l  m and n a high deductible plan f be also available that feature a $2140 deductible in 2014 each plan offer certain benefit some more comprehensive than other each plan must cover a core set of benefit also know as the basic benefit the basic benefit be 1) Medicare part A coinsurance plus coverage for 365 additional day after Medicare benefit be use up Medicare part b coinsurance or copayment 3) first 3 pint of blood 4) part a hospice care coinsurance or copayment there be a total of 9
